reviewText: not too smooth
Great work ring for my husband.

I have only just recently looked into "spinner" style rings for my son, who likes to fidget a lot while doing most activities that require concentration. This is our second spinner style ring, so I had something to compare this to.

First off, this is a fairly masculine style ring, and what is pictured is what you get. When we got it (which took a little while, but we anticipated that), I personally put it on one of my fingers and gave it a test. The inside portion that "spins" actually spins around easily, much to our delight. I found myself actually enjoying wearing it and flicking my thumb on it to make it spin around and around endlessly while doing stuff (or reading something). For people with sensory needs or a need for extra stimulation while attempting to concentrate, this is actually a pretty interesting accessory to use. It makes a very faint sound while spinning, but no squeaks or annoying noises while doing so. My son loves it even better than the last one we purchased not too long ago.

While I was spinning it around, I presumed that both the gold and black portions in the middle spun together, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that while they can indeed spin together, they are independent of each other and can be spun separately if desired. It sounds silly, but my son loves that feature about it.

Regardless, the actual ring is pretty heavy-feeling and super sturdy. The patterns in the gold and black portions work very well with the silver, and looks like a unique and classy accessory for a tween/teen boy or man. My husband was impressed with it and actually wanted one for himself, too, because it looks so nice. I don't anticipate this coming apart any time soon, and overall, we all were even more impressed with this product than we anticipated. In addition to needing to order one for my husband, I actually liked the feeling of it (aside from how masculine it looked, but I did not purchase this for me) so much that I am starting to look into a more feminine version of this to order for myself. One of my son's friends (who also squirms and fidgets a lot) thought it was the most awesome ring he had ever seen and started begging his mom for one, too. It is really that "cool"!

I received this product at a discount for an unbiased review that reflects my honest opinions about the product. I did not receive compensation, was never compelled by the seller to do anything other than review it, and I never guarantee 5 stars, ever! If I don't like the product and/or don't feel it is a good value, it certainly will not get a good rating from me. I try to be reasonably detailed in my reviews so people can make a more informed decision on whether or not the product is worth buying.
summary: Looks Really Nice and Fantastic For All Fidgety Males!

reviewText:
This shirt is lovely. It looks so great on my husband and it fits him wonderfully. No need for tailoring with the cut of the shirt. I was worried the accents would look cheap, but they don't.

My husband reports that the fabric is soft and light. A great looking shirt!

This shirt could be awesome but it's not quite there. I bought the XL for my 6'2" husband. It was a perfect fit....slim, tailored. The only problem was the sleeves were a good 3" short. (To be fair, this happens often when you need at least a 36 1/2" sleeve.)

The fabric isn't heavy, but the shirt isn't priced like you would expect it to be. The pattern is good-looking, and the construction of the shirt is done with the kind of skill you would expect in a high-end dress shirt. Every seam in impeccably sewn.

Then there are the details that I can never find: the solid collar lining on the color, the reversed out pocket tipping, the contrast stitching. Even the button are perfectly matched to these accents,

I ended up giving the shirt to a family friend. He, too, says it's a cheap shirt because of the fabric but a darn good-looking one!

I purchased this item at a discount in return for writing this honest and unbiased review.

I am always looking for affordable fashion options and especially with designs that are hot now and won't be so hot later. Most times I make purchases with the idea I want the items to last, so I opt for classical styles and I must admit, my wardrobe starts to look kind of boring. Everything starts looking alike and the difference may be same cuts but in different colors or patterns.

In comes Romwe, and they distribute both via their website and on Amazon. Buying clothes on-line can be iffy at times. You just don't know how sizing runs and certain production lines may run true to fit, while then you get a huge swing where items start then running large. Being that I was new to Romwe, I decided to play it safe and ordered one size up. Romwe differs where they list how their sizes run for each item, but I did notice where I may be a small in one version/style, I could easily jump to a medium in another style. Like with every female we run into issues where some shirts you just don't want to pop out of!

I selected two items to review and now comes the Bohemian Shirt style dress in a blue toned fabric. Being that I have Prime on Amazon, I did not experience a delay in delivery. All items were in stock and shipped rather quickly. This is where I had a difficult time choosing a size that fir accordingly because of the dimensions listed.

Sizing (as listed on Amazon):

XS: Bust:31.5 inch, Length:32 inch,Sleeve Length:22.8 inch
S: Bust:32 inch, Length:32.5 inch,Sleeve Length:23 inch
M: Bust:33.5 inch, Length:33 inch,Sleeve Length:23.2 inch
L: Bust:35 inch, Length:33.5 inch,Sleeve Length:23.4 inch

Retail Price Point: Via Amazon, the dress is $24.19 and free shipping if you have Prime membership.

There is no waist or hip size! I looked at the dress on-line and noticed there was not a fabric listed, so I had no idea if the dress had give or not. I figured if the dress was too tight in the chest area, a tank top could fix that.  I opted on going with a size that is more true fit on the chest, thinking it would then flow a little loose on the waist and hips, as per the style (fitting) on the model. I went with a size Small. The dress gets here and I should have gone with an X-Small! The dress is very largely cut and the dimensions listed are not a true representation. I love the style but the cut (final piece) is not sewn or like the picture, and this is the one I had higher hopes on. I call it a tarp but my Husband calls it a frock. If you have a waist, it's all lost in the shirt. The dress has pockets, creating again that replication of bunching that I had with the first dress where it was sewn. There is no light flow to the fabric, as it is 100% polyester. This means no breathable feeling when worn. I'm short, so the arms were a perfect length but because there is elastic at the ends, my elastic band is still loose around the wrist. I attribute this to going a size up even though my chest/breast area is between a 33 and 34, this dress is lose there but the sewing on the shoulders......well, it was not done evenly. The shoulder area (seam) rests on the front of my shoulders, not on the shoulders themselves. Think collarbone. The dress is closed on the front by one stitch, which cause a gap if you move in it. I will be removing the stitch to stop this from happening and altering it so a tank top shows, but not so down that my undies show. This will also fix that forward like feeling of where the seams rest. My pockets sag because that is how much fabric gathers at the hips and waist. I think if we knew the model's size (height, dimensions and waist/hip sizing because mine looks like it belongs on a large versus a small). If I ordered an extra small and the seamstress was the same one......well, the seams issues would have been the same. I wanted to love this dress but I think mine was just cut way too big on the bottom to be able to enjoy it and it look flattering on me. One thing is a little baggy for comfort/casual and another thing is so baggy that I am swimming in it.  The reason for the extra star, I can fix this dress.  I have a sewing machine and will be altering it but this is not always an option for everyone.  I also noticed by the reviews, the sizing is all over where some reviewers found the dress to fitting and some to loose.  I again attribute this to maybe this design the sewing/fitting is all over the place.  Kind of how the sleeve states 3/4 length but on the model that is not the case.  My dress also does not rest shorter on the front and longer on the back, it's just the same all around.

reviewText:
I own a number of sports bras and they are not as comfortable as this one.  I ordered the large, as I am normally a 36C, and it fits well.  I ordered the peak green and it is bright and pretty, just like the picture.  The material is soft and with just the right amount of stretch.  It has enough compression to hold things in place, while not giving the feeling that I am being squeezed by a vice.  The straps are wide and adjustable, so they do not cut into my shoulders.  There is padding in this bra, which can be removed from the pockets by an opening on each side of the cup.  The back is racerback style, which adds to the comfort when I am exercising.  It makes such a big difference when I am exercising and I can wear something that gives the support I need, yet is comfortable to wear.  I would recommend this sports bra.

reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: I have been given this product at a discount for my completely honest and unbiased review.

First... beware that shipping takes forever. It took over a month to get this.

Second, this is not well made. There is a lot of decent quality material, but the seams are the downfall. I washed this ONCE and hang-dried it, not once in the dryer, and seams are already breaking. Areas are bunch and twisted all weird and awkwardly... This is a very cute dress, but with how it's already falling apart, it's really more of a $5 dress then a $10 dress. Treat this gently.

Now, I will add that the sizing is right. Often times, clothing from China runs small, but I have had pretty good luck with accurate sizing from this brand.

I have photos of the loosening and breaking seams attached as well as one of the twisted and uneven areas.

The seam on the fancy shoulder strap was coming undone, the dress looks like a tunic that would fit a 4 year old. (I ordered a 7) Runs incredibly small. I have had better luck with Fiream's cotton items. This dress was disappointing.

I received this at a discount to try out and share my opinions. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no extra anything if I do. My goal is to tell buyers more than a simple product description provided by the manufacturer, pros, cons, and not sell the product for the manufacturer by way of false reviews. My remarks are true and unique. I hope they help other buyers. Are items discounted or free? Sure. But it ends there. Again, these are just my thoughts, your own opinion might vary. I received no monetary compensation and am not required to give a good review.

reviewText:
After waiting 3-4 weeks for her new dress, my 7 year old daughter was quite disappointed.

The fabric, color, and style were all very nice. But the craftsmanship was not.

The back of the dress was all bunched up and the dress is far a wider child. I got the size 7 and my 7 year old had 2 inches left over on each side of the dress. My 9 year old who wears a size 10 normally could fit this but she is taIler so it was more like a shirt than a dress. On both kids the back bunched up so this dress is not wearable. reviewText:
I was looking for an activewear bikini that didn't look to sporty (one-piece suits are usually too long in the torso for my petite and short-waisted body), and this bikini seemed to fit the bill. It didn't look like it would slip off from jumping into a waterfall. But I was terribly confused reading the reviews. Several reviewers had me believing that the XS would better fit a doll than an adult human body. Just to be safe, I ordered the suit in both XS and S.

It turned out the XS was almost a perfect fit, and for reference, I am 5' tall and 95 lbs. The top was tricky at first to figure out how to put on, because there are no clasps -- you have to pull what seem like miles of straps on over your head in a precise configuration -- but after just a minute laying it flat in front of me, I saw how it needed to be and slipped into it just fine. The bust pads are a little large and bulky, but they are removable and easy to switch out. The straps are a little long on me, so it isn't quite as snug as I'd like. And design-wise, the actual bikini top is a little different from the photo: at the front, where the straps cross over each other, there is a potential gap that gets wider the bigger the bust. IMO this doesn't look terrible, but if you had your heart set on the suit looking exactly like the photo, this may disappoint you. You could sew them together with just a few stitches if you really want to, and it wouldn't ruin a thing. I suspect that the swimsuit manufacturer was "inspired by" the swimsuit in the photo, because there are too many subtle differences for the swimsuit I received to be the same as the swimsuit in the photo.

Here is a list of all the ways I see that the actual suit is different from the photo:
1. The straps that go around the neck are narrower than in the photo.
2. The crossover section at the front separates instead of overlaps.
3. The straps aren't cut to angle as much on the body as the photo would suggest.
4. The fabric is not as matte as the fabric in the photo.
5. The bottoms are cut more straight / horizontal, not as curved as in the photo.

And here are the qualities that earn this swimsuit a 5-star rating from me:
1. It's still a well designed and decently produced product. It's not going to fall apart.
2. It's flattering.
3. I can sew, and am comfortable making the modification of shortening the strap using my sewing machine.
4. For under $20, this suit is a great value.

I can only chalk up some of the negative reviews to missed expectation, and I'm sorry, but that is not the suit's fault. No swimsuit will fit and flatter every body. No swimsuit will turn my body into the body of the model, so of course the suit will look different on me than it does on the model. Sizes vary from label to label, so I wouldn't assume that wearing a size Y everywhere else should automatically mean I wear a size Y in this suit (vanity sizing is out of control but that is a whole new topic). It is confusing to put on, because it is a complicated design compared to a triangle top -- and that's probably why most people like it. And to say the suit feels cheap? IT IS CHEAP IT ONLY COST $15-20!!! I don't think any of these are good reasons to trash the suit. Instead, if you read the reviews, looking for feedback from people who have similar height, weight, and measurements, you will probably get your best idea whether this is a good suit for you or not. I was glad to read the review from the gal who is 5'3" and 95 lbs and said the XS was perfect for her. I had a feeling this would work out for me.
summary: Great suit for the money -- read reviews carefully, esp those from people whose measurements are similar to your

I realize these aren't expensive sunglasses, but they feel super cheap and rattle-y. They came with a pretty nice case, a cleaning cloth, and a little glasses repair screwdriver. I'd rather they had skipped all that and just put a little more quality into the glasses.

reviewText: Good product and great service. Thank you.

"Calvin Klein Blazer Brown Herringbone Two Button New Men's Sport Coat" My advice to the seller is that slim-fit should be part of the title, and make it part of the item's metadata, too, so that the jacket can be easily excluded by filters. This blazer is tighter than I prefer, but the material looks and feels great.

A tailor confirmed for me that the blazer had never been altered, but I am not convinced the jacket is brand new: it had a Macy's label sewn inside. Nothing wrong with reselling, but it was jarring to see the Macy's label when I recall none from the item description.

Those are my only complaints, though, and the jacket is definitely four stars.
summary: Read the item description with a fine tooth comb -- and hope it was not edited after you bought!

reviewText: My daughter asked me to purchase this item for her after a friend recommended it.  Her prom dress this year required a strapless, invisible bra.  When this item arrived it was as pictured and described.  She is a "B" cup, but based on comments here I ordered a "C" and it ended up being a wise decision because this bra does run a bit small.  The bra itself is nicely made.  It was simple to put on and take off.  It definitely made her look bigger than a B cup by pushing her assets together.  Our goal was to provide coverage for a "skimpy" dress.  This definitely did the job well in that area.  She did not feel uncomfortable wearing the bra and was pleased with the coverage that it gave her.  Since we have also struggled with many tops that have the same issues as her dress I know that this bra will get a lot of use.  I received promotional pricing on this item in exchange for sharing my thoughts on it.
summary: Worked Well With Daughter's Prom Dress

reviewText: So this bra does seem well made.  The adhesive was non-irritating to me and worked great. That all said I am not fond of this bra.  I am 33 years old and have nursed 2 children. Unfortunately I don't think I will wear this one again.  If you are younger, have not nursed children, or have had breast augmentation than this bra will probably be fine for you.  I just needed one that helped with shape and support more. I received a discount on this item for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: I did not care for this particular adhesive bra.

reviewText: I have always wondered how this would work for me. It is a great idea. I have some clothing that this would be perfect for. It came quickly, but I soon realized that this is definitely not going to work for me. It looks like it is made well. It is 100% pure medical-grade silicone. It is supposed to be easy to care for, you simply wash with warm water and mild soap then air dry. When the item is dry, the adhesive regenerates itself for next use. I think it may work great for those who are not "gifted" in that area, but if you are a larger gal I would pass on it. I will be giving this to my daughter. I hope she likes it. She has a few dresses that this would be perfect for. I will update on how it works for her. I cannot say that it is a bad product, it just is not going to work for me. One thing that I really did not like though, is when I opened the box there were a few live tiny bugs inside the plastic. I ran to see if there were any in the Amazon box and that was clean so I have to think they were from the seller. I did receive a discount in exchange for giving my honest and unbiased opinion of this product.

reviewText: Not as much padding as I expected.

Zity Men's 3D Padded Bicycle Cycling Underwear Shorts #3PaddeBicyclCyclinUnderweaShorts I ordered these a size larger due to them being spandex and I know as my personal preference that I don't want it too tight. These for sure take some getting used to, but I went ahead and tried them out. As most of the reviews I have seen so far, they so feel like you're wearing a giant diaper or pad. But it gets the job done when you're going on that long bike ride. I have had some issues in the past while riding that my butt is sore and with these, I it wasn't sore at all. The padding is in the perfect spot where the seat is. I can where them discreetly under my shorts and even tho they feel to be extremely noticeable they really aren't. I would recommend these for anyone that is into riding bikes for long trips. As well as bike sports. ***I received this product at free or discounted price for my true and honest review***

reviewText:
This arrived today and as much as I wanted to like it I have to admit its just all around not even worth the $8 I spent on it. I fell well under the size noted on the chart so I felt comfortable ordering the largest size available. Unfortunately where I should have had at least 4" of extra space the item fell at least 3" from even closing in the front so that's a huge difference.
I was prepared for the slits creating 4 panels and, thinking it would be a few inches too big, I figured I could sew them closed in the back and possibly halfway down on the sides. There was no chance as the sizing left no way to close the garment itself and even left hanging open the panels hung a couple of inches apart.
The colors were great and the lightweight fabric was exactly what I was looking for but right out of the package the entire right side from hip seam to arm was ripped open, it looked as if someone had tried it on and damaged it.
Overall a very disappointing purchase and I would not recommend this to anyone unless you intend to give out to a 10 year old to play in which is what I did.

I purchased these dinosaur pajamas in a size 9 for six dollars which I thought was a great price. Pajamas generally run small so I was thinking these might fit my 5 year old but they actually fit my 8 year old perfectly. I think the shorts might've worked for my 5 yr old because they are elastic but the shirt was a better fit for his big brother. The print is adorable & the colors are just as bright in person. I was afraid they would look too pink to pass with my 8 year old but it's more of a neon red if there is such a color so he thought nothing of it. The material is soft & good quality. I have been machine washing but hanging them to dry just to make sure they didn't shrink or fade. I hope these will get many years of use between my three boys.

This pajama set is really cute and just like the picture.  They are all cotton.  I got my 5-year-old son a pair he can wear for years.  The cotton is actually pretty thick, not like the really thin cheap cotton you sometimes find in clothes.  I'll admit that a thinner material would be nice for the summer, but then you'll probably get holes in them.  These are sturdy and seem well sewn and constructed.  I'm sure my boy would prefer a dragon pair, but he likes dinosaurs too.  He accidentally said jamamas instead of pajamas the other night, so we have been calling all pajamas that since.  Too cute (like these pajamas).

Note: I received a discount to purchase this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.  I look at each item at its regular un-discounted price and try to establish its quality value to that.

reviewText: Adorable!!! My son does not want to take it off. So soft and cozy.... I'm buying more.

I am very impressed with this pajama set! It's quality is comparable to higher end brands I purchase like Mini Boden and L.L. Bean. I wasn't expecting this set to be so nice. I ordered size 8-9 years and it does fit like 8/9 T U.S. Despite being labeled as pajamas this set doesn't really scream it which makes it versatile in my kids wardrobe. I wouldn't hesitate putting this on my child for a daytime outing. The design is exactly as pictured. The dinosaurs are painted on both shorts and top. The cotton material does have stretch including the neck hole for children with larger heads. The fabric is very soft! I did have slight fading after the initial wash but I can't say if it was this brand or the way I washed it in warm with extra detergent like I do for all new clothing to remove leftover chemicals from manufacturing. The fading was very slight, not enough to warrant a lower star rating. Most importantly my child adores this set and refuses to take it off when at home!

reviewText: This bracelet is eye-catching and colorful without being too flashy. It is delicate and so sparkly. The topaz glistens in cool hues of purple to aqua to green. The sterling silver hardware is simple with clean, bold lines. Yet it is all done daintily enough that I think young and old alike will love this. It is classic, yet not dated. Because of the multi-faceted colors in the topaz, this can be worn with so many outfits. This bracelet is well made, and the clasp is adjustable and I think it will fit most wrists. This is an absolutely stunning bracelet that is made of genuine topaz and sterling silver. It is beautiful and offers just the bit of color that I sometimes am looking for. Can I just say that I have never owned more durable, comfortable and all-around better sandals regardless of manufacturer. I hate spending a lot on my sandals if I'm being honest, however--I'm willing to as long as I know what I'm getting will not only be comfortable, but also last me for a long time. My very first pair of Timberland sandals lasted me in excess of 5 years of heavy use. They would have lasted longer, but I accidentally left them in the trunk of a car I got rid of a few years back. I was REALLY upset when I finally realized my mistake, too.

I have tried a few big name sandals in the meantime to see if they could match my Timberland's...namely Chaco's and Teva's--both very well-known and came with high recommendations. Chaco's just couldn't satisfy my need for comfort. I felt they were way too stiff and just plain no cushion whatsoever. They sure looked nice, though. But that is only a small portion of total satisfaction. Teva's certainly were much more comfortable, and also pretty durable as well. I felt these were my least favorite however as far as looks went. But hey, they were comfortable and durable, so I have 2 pairs of good Teva's that I still enjoy.

None of them can equal the look and durability (IMO) of real world use that I got from my Timberlands. Let me admit one more thing: my original Timberland sandals had a different sole, which provided much more cushion, and less texture for the bottoms of my feet to have to get used to. Not sure why they changed it, maybe because it added additional traction to the skin of your feet...? I dunno. I just feel that the original sole was just much more comfortable literally right out of the box. The Wakeby's require a few days of acclimating, which I must admit, did not sit well at first. However, after a 2-3 days of wearing them, my feet got used to them to the point where they felt much more comfortable. This could be a turn off for some, but I say give it a few days and you'll be as happy as I am. I DO wish they would go back to the original design that I remember and miss so much...but that could be just my personal wishes.

Durability-wise, its hard to beat the Timberland design. Especially the leather version. I had a pair of them I bought last year that had nylon straps (one of which never seemed to line up for some odd reason) and the nylon just became frayed way too easily. The bottom sole however is still almost brand new looking. Not sure what they make them out of, but holy cow its durable stuff. They also provide great traction on a multitude of surfaces, whether wet or dry. A huge plus if you ask me.

Plus, as far as looks go, I think they simply cannot be beat...but I also realize this is definitely subjective depending on what you look for in sandals. In my opinion, if you are looking for long-lasting and comfortable sandals that will provide you with great traction on everything from backwoods trails, to rock climbing to casual walking around waiting in line at Disneyland, Timberland is the brand to go with. I am uber satisfied.
summary: Just About The Best Sandals Made Anywhere

reviewText:
This is just the thing I've always needed! I really like having something like this skirt on hand. It is not only super comfy, but it also fits me perfectly and looks really nice. The fabric is luxurious, yet at the same time, casual. Sometimes in the Summer time, when it gets too hot to wear pants, but not hot enough to wear shorts, skirts can come in really handy. This skirt may be a bit too thick for me to wear in the Summer time, at least during the day, but for evening wear, this would definitely work. Especially if there's a nice breeze going on...not so much if it's hot, humid and there's no breeze though. I can see myself wearing this in the Fall though, for sure.
So, this skirt is made out of that slinky, silky kind of material, and it's not see-through thin, nor is it real thick. It drapes very nicely and I like the loose stretch, because it's not restricting or tight. There's no tight elastic waist band either, and there's plenty of give, but it stays on the waist. This skirt is made here in the U.S, in Los Angeles, so there's no having to worry about trying to convert U.S. sizes to Asian ones. I chose the size Small, which fits size 4-6 U.S. There are 7 different color & design options to choose from and it comes in 4 sizes. And because this skirt has the fold-over waistband, it can fit many different heights. I'm only 5' 3" and the hem hits me at the ankles. I can probably make it shorter by pulling it up further if I wanted. I really like the versatility of this simple design. It can be worn with a blouse (or top) either tucked in or out, and would look nice with a wrap-around or wide belt. You can wear this dressy or casual , day or night, or from day-to-night. The possibilities are many, just let your imagination run wild. I was given a promotional discount, in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: I like the versatility of this simply, designed pull-on skirt.

reviewText: I really liked this maxi dress and wore it the other day for the first time. It is super cute and comfy and I will able to wear it with a lot of different tops this summer for outfits. But do be mindful that the fabric is very sheer and it does not tell you that when you buy it. I made the mistake of finding that out the hard way wearing bright blue underwear underneath it and then realizing only after I had gotten to work already that it was totally see through if I bent down at all. My co-worker told me and I was totally stressed over it the rest of the night until I could get home for the day. It is night otherwise. * I received this product for a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion *

reviewText: This seems like a dcenet skirt. The material is very soft, but the real test will be when the humidity settles in. I really don't like when a skirt sticks to me in the humidity, so this skirt is waiting for that test. The length was a bit short on me. I'm 5'7, so I will have to have a shorter roll and wear it a little lower, but I think that will be ok. The fit was a bit on the small side. I wear a small/medium. I ordered this in medium because of other reviewer responses, and it fits perfectly. It does not show my bumps and lumps, so that's a good thing. I'm really just hoping that the material willserve me during those really humid summer days. A long a-line skirt can do wonders in the summer if the material is just right. I know that polyster is the worst, so I'm hoping that this newer synthetic works for me. The quality of the skirt seems ok. There are no lose threads or anything, but I think it will crease easily as it came creased from the backaging. I also worry about washing it. I have a few rayon tops that have shrunken even being washed on cold and hanged dry. I will update this post with washing results. I look forward to an enjoyable summer with this skirt as a wardrobe addition.

I have this skirt on right now and it looks great with my blouse and sandals for work.  I will also definitely wear this with a tank top or over a swimsuit.  It fits perfectly and is super comfortable.  I love the fold over waist; its really soft and can be positioned just right for how you want to wear it.  The length is perfect on me as well.  The stitching is well done and seems like it will last a long time.  I bought one in black, but now Im thinking I may need a few more in other colors. reviewText: very nice and cute

This a blue undertone red skirt, like the classic lipstick red. It is long enough to be ankle length on me and I am 5'7".  It is well made with no loose threads or stitches coming out and the seams and hems are all even. The fabric seems to be high quality jersey cotton or cotton with spandex. It's soft and light, not so heavy that it weighs itself down over the course of the day and soon you feel like you are having to pull it up every 5 minutes to keep it from falling down around your feet. It is about 42" inches long, I measured from the unfolded waist down the seam to the bottom hem of the skirt. You can play around with the length by folding or unfolding the waist and pulling it up or down on your hips. It's thin enough that if folded down at the waist several times, it would not be obvious and bulky. This could be pulled up to make a strapless midi dress that falls right below your knee or mid calf depending on your height. I have mostly worn this with tank tops and tshirts and kept it very casual, but you could pair it with a dressier top and it would look fine as well. My body shape is pear or hourglass, depending on what I wear underneath. My body measurements are 43" bust (measured at the fullest part)/ 34" waist (natural)/44" hips(fullest). I ordered an XL and it fits well. There is quite a bit of stretch and give to this material, so if you wear a 12 to an 18 like I do depending on the make, brand, and material, the XL will fit you. I also pulled at the waist to see how far it would stretch comfortably. Be aware it not the most forgiving fabric, it will show lumps, bumps, and panty lines. Wear appropriate undergarments, lol! There is no care tag sewn into the skirt and nothing came in the plastic as far as care instructions, but with this type of material I have always machine washed on gentle in cold water, while inside out, and hung to dry, with good results. It keeps my other clithing made from similar material from pilling and looking worn. The stitching and craftsmanship of this skirt are very nice and the fabric seems to be a good quality. I found a tag thanking me for my business and talking about where it is located, etc. Made in the USA, that's a plus! I have been impatiently waiting on this skirt to be delivered ever since the day I ordered it. Lol!
I received a discount on this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I hope you have found my review helpful. Thank you!

The design and construction of these ear crawlers are excellent, which is why they deserve 5 stars, even though it turns out I can't wear the full set.  The restrained simplicity of the crescent moon and bright cubic zirconia makes for one of the most elegant ear crawler designs I've ever seen, and the sterling silver ear wires are surprisingly sturdy, while also being ideal for sensitive ears.

 Unfortunately,  I'm cursed with uneven piercings, and while ear crawlers have turned out to be a great way to visually even things out, in this particular case, the position of my lowest piercing means that these crawlers won't stay on my earlobe.  The problem is that the hole on one side is very close to the bottom of my earlobe.  Due to the position of the ear wire, which starts at the very end of the crescent, and the curve of the moon shape, I can't get the ear wire to grip enough of my ear to stay in the right position.  Which means that the whole thing slips off and pivots downwards, just like a fish hook or french wire earring.  (In the photos below, I show what it looks like when the earring slips off the ear.)

I have other ear crawlers that work well for me, and the difference is that they have ear wires that start a little more toward the middle of the design.  It's just a fluke that the ear wire here is in just the right position relative to the crescent to slip off, unfortunately. You'll need a lot of earlobe space for these crescents, because they're quite large, measuring 7/8 of an inch from one end of the crescent to the other.

You can tell they've used good CZs because of the amount of "fire" they have---it's actually surprising, considering their small diameter.  These crescents look and feel a lot more expensive than they really are.  They're excellent, and my only regret is that I can't wear the full set myself due to the low piercing on one side---but I'm tempted to mix and match.  Maybe a single CZ stud on one side, and a crawler on the other.

---Promotional sample provided for the purpose of evaluation and objective review.---

What a great dress!  Shipping took much longer than I expected, but once I received it, I have to say- it's great!  The dress itself fits just as I wanted it to, it's not too tight, it's not too loose.  The fabric itself is a black lace cover, and underneath it is a full body polyester (cream colored) slip.  The slip and black lace dress are sewn together.  That slip feels so silky and soft and smooth!  It feels so great against my skin.  The sleeves come down just below my elbows, and the neckline is fairly high.  It's not a terribly revealing dress.  The skirt goes down past the knees, but it raises a lot.  When I move or sit down, it raises up.

The only thing I say as a caution is that unless you have an amazing body, wear a body shaper under this.  I have some extra weight on me, and every last bit of it shows (even though the dress is loose in some places).  When I tried it on last night, I was a little dismayed by how it looked.  I wore it today with a body shaper and it smoothed and firmed me up- it looked great!  This is a dress you can easily wear to work or for a date or event out.  It's classy, beautiful, and moves well.  Like I said, it bunches up, so you'll have to adjust it a lot, but the dress itself is worth it!

reviewText:
I have seriously found my new favorite dress! While I have been on the search for updating, and bettering my wardrobe, due to taking on a more professional level, dresses are becoming essential in my daily life. I have never been a "dress" kind of gal, so this is also like a new adventure. Needing a professional dress, but not wanting to pay a couple hundred dollars per dress has also been a challenge of itself. While I can find many in the stores that I really like, I am also not willing to pay that kind of money for something. I would not do that for jeans, shoes, or anything! So finding this brand online here, with a much MUCH cheaper price, and good reviews, I knew I needed to give it a try. It took a very long time to ship, and to get here. They did warn about this, though, so I was alright with it. Once received, it fit absolutely perfectly! Form fitting, but not clingy, the lace detail is very cute and chic. The black color is flat black, and it will literally match anything and everything. The collar is a high scoop-neck, but this helps to ensure the professionalism of it. Overall, it is great material and is constructed very well. I would not run this through the washer or dryer. Dry cleaners will be mandatory, but well worth it for this quality!

* I received this dress at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Ok, I will begin this review by getting the negative out of the way. When I got this dress in, it looked really big, and shapeless...like a straight garment bag if you will. I'd followed the size chart, and have ordered from this company before so I ordered the same size, and really thought I'd ordered a size too large this time. But alas, once I put it on, I was pleasantly surprised! While the dress is a tiny bit on the large size for me, it's nothing that would prevent me from wearing it. As a matter of fact, I slipped this dress on and fell in love with it!! The fabric is super soft and sleek and forms to your body. It's silky, it's cool, it's non-constricting.  I absolutely love it! The color is gorgeous as well, and absolutely compliments blue eyes. I wash this dress in delicate and then hang dry and it's held together quite nicely.
Overall, do not judge the garment simply by looking at it...trust me, it looks much better on! Beautiful!!

reviewText: F\or the functional aspect of this product, the pendant does its job.  It hold the Shine 2 in place without any issues of it popping out. My only gripe about this product is that the chain that is shipped with the product is too short and feels flimsy.  For me, metal on flesh with a short, almost choker-style chain, is not going to work.  I did buy a $9 rubber rope cord to go with this (ELLITE Wide Alloy Black Rubber Cord Rope Necklace Chain(18 - 24 Inch) with Stainless Steel Lobster Clasp ) and it has been working out great!  Very comfortable and you can workout with the pendant/cord combo.

Cheaper than it looks and not worth the price. Nevertheless it is probably the best necklace this far for the shine 2. I'm not shure the shine 2 supports being worn as a necklace yet and it may not be accurate in this fashion.

I had to send mine back as it was very tight when inserting into the drone connectors and I felt like it was going to break the connector inside, not willing to take that chance so I never even finished plugging it in.  The battery also would not fit in my third party charger (dual battery charger) which to me indicates that the connectors must not be in just the right spot to fit both the charger and the drone.  I have no issues with the stock batteries in the drone or the charger as well as some other third party batteries (Venom, MorPilot) so I suspect poor quality control during manufacturing since some people seem to have no issues with theirs.  Going to have to send this one back and just use the others I have since there is no replacement option for this through Amazon.

I have giving 3 stars since the seller promptly responded to my message and after asking for pictures (not sure why they need pics since I could not show the connector not aligning due to the battery compartment being completely enclosed) they sent me a return label and they say they will refund me when the item is received.
summary: Seems connectors are not properly aligned.

I love the colors & the retro print of this Bohemian Floral Print Shift Dress by Romwe. It has a light satiny feel & is perfect for summer. The fabric is breathable, it doesnt cling & all of the seams are strong & straight. I wear a womens size 8 - 10 so I ordered this dress in Medium & I like the way it fits. This dress can easily dressed up or dressed down. Dress it up with accessories & a cute pair of wedges or dress it down by wearing it over leggings or capris with a cute pair of flat sandals. It will also make a super cute swimsuit cover-up for the pool or beach.
However you choose to wear this dress, be ready for lots of compliments!
As a product review blogger, I often receive products free or at a deep discount in exchange for my honest review. The opinions expressed are 100% my own based on my personal use of the product.

ROMWE Women's Bohemian Floral Print Ethnic Style Shift Dress

Very nice dress.  Fits as expected, size large.  The fabric is breathable and light.  I love the print and modern design.  Is open on the back.  Great to wear for this summer.  Can be wear as a dress or with leggings.  Is a casual look to go out during the day wearing sandals or wedges.  Perfect for a pool party, BBQ family reunion, birthday party at the park or backyard and more.  Is also great to use as a bikini/swimwear cover up to the pool or beach.  Recommended.

I hope you find this review helpful. If you have any questions you can comment below and I will be more than happy to help you. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review. Thanks & Happy Shopping! :)

reviewText: The first thing I'd like to say is that I've received a ton of compliments about it. It is light, airy, and perfect for summer. I love it. You can choose to wear it with a belt, but I liked it without one. The pieces around the wrist do have a tendency to leave minor impressions in your skin, depending upon how large your arms are. I ordered a small, which is the size that I normally wear. This dress had plenty of room, and it wasn't tight nor clingy. The patterns are light, vibrant, and very retro and stylish. I do recommend wearing this with an undershirt or something sleeveless, just because the back is open. The material feels a little like satin as well. This has quickly become one of my favorites. I am going to wear it at least once a week, for a while. I like it that much. Please look at my video of me wearing this, pending approval. I hope you find this helpful. I have no complaints or suggestions for improvement. I did wear this with some leggings. I recommend this. I received this for free, and all of my thoughts and opinions are 100% my own and are not influenced by anyone in any way.

reviewText:
I bought this GPS watch to help my 7 year old son. He has severe Autism. He is non-verbal, he wanders, he causes self-harm. My little guy needs constant care. But I still want to teach him to be independent. To feel safe at home, we have surveillance cameras in place, dead bolts etc to make sure he stays safe. This GPS was supposed to help with extra safety at home, but also when he goes to school, or when we go to the park, stores, fairs, beach, anywhere. We do not shelter him, we want him to live his life like any other kid his age! I purchased this watch in the hopes of having the GPS function on him at all times, being able to talk to him through the walkie talkie, telling him to come upstairs, telling him I will be there to help in a minute, those types of things. So, I bought this and here is my experience.
First, I ordered Blue and it came in Pink. Contacted support and nothing about replacing the watch because of such a drastic switch in color. I'm sorry, but my kid has it tough enough, now he is supposed to wear a bright pink watch instead of the blue I ordered for him? That is just not right. For such a high price I should get what I ordered.
Second, everything is in another language. Everything. I can't make out how to get this working. It is just awful. When I contacted support they helped me download the right app. The app they say to download is the wrong app. So they sent me an email with downloadable instructions. I tried for 5 days straight to try to get it to work. It wouldn't. Battery life ran out super fast and I had to keep charging just to try to get it to work.
Anyways, I gave everything to my husband to try. I gave up. He is really great with technology. He spent over a week trying to get it to work. He looked up videos, nothing, he tried following the download, nothing worked. It is impossible.
I would not suggest this product to anyone whether their child needs it because of a serious disability or not.
I received this watch for a discount for my honest and unbiased opinion.
summary: Very unhappy, wrong color, impossible to set up.

reviewText: I'm in love with this one

When they say this item is XXL - what they actually mean is that it is XXL by South Asian clothing standards.  I have recently found that an American 2XL or XXL person should actually be purchasing 4XL or 5XL (depending on your body shape) with regards to these items.  I strongly recommend you ask the seller in advance of purchasing these nehru vests about sizing before ordering, or you will likely get something FAR too small for you.

The XXL would likely fit a M or L by American clothing standards.
summary: Sizes are totally misleading - totally unfortunate!

It's okay. First, it definitely doesn't seem like a cotton blend. It seems like a very silky material, but is probably like polyester and rayon. The sizing is just always goofy with Asian manufacturers. The chart comparison is close, but even so, mine came a bit too large and I'm not sure if I'll even wear it. There's no way this is shrinking and seems like it's not very breathable. Both the body and the sleeves seem longer than a normal US t-shirt would be. It does have an 'athletic' cut/feel to it, but if the sizing is off it won't fit right. I normally wear a Med. to Lg. in US t-shirts, depending on the manufacturer. I used the size chart & got the equivalent of a US large. It feels like a lg. + 1/2. So I either have to gain weight, or wear a thicker shirt under it in order to fill it out. If it was cotton, I may consider reordering, but I'm not into silky shirts so, I'll hang on to it for awhile to see if I ever wear it, but it will probably end up at Goodwill within 2 years.

I'm a big fan of the open cardigan concept.  Not only are they stylish and cute, they also keep me warm in our frigid offices at work. The black one I've had for years has been looking worn and pilled for a while now, so I bought this one online at a discount for my honest and unbiased review to replace it.  Here are my thoughts on this Elain & J Long Sleeve Open Cardigan:

IT'S THIN
The material is very thin, much thinner than I expected. If held to the light, it is see-through. This can be a pro or con -- it's doesn't keep me as warm, but then again it's also not too heavy when I just need something light covering me.

THE TAILS ARE LONG
The woman in the model picture must have a very long torso. The longest part (the front) of the garment comes down just a few inches above my knee.  It covers my rear in the back as well. I ordered a small and am 5 feet tall.

IT'S SHEDDING?
I've only had this cardigan for a few days, but I noticed today that I had tiny black pieces of fabric on my pants.  I rubbed the cardigan in my hands and sure enough, I had a small amount of fabric shedding in my hands. Maybe this goes away after a few washes?

Overall, I like it -- it serves the purpose I need for work and it goes well with everything.  I wish it was a little bit better quality, but I plan to keep wearing it either way.

I did receive the product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review, but that in no way affects my opinion. Even at full price, this is an incredible bargain for a cardigan similar to what you would find at higher end department stores. I plan to buy more in some of the other lovely colors offered!

reviewText: I am very happy with the quality and feel of this cardigan. It is very well made and it fits me very well. It lays nicely around my neck and is a good length. The sleeves are a tiny bit long on me, but that is not very uncommon for me. The front hangs down a little lower and it looks very cute on. I ordered the navy and it does look exactly as it is pictured. It is a little thinner material, but it is not really see though. It is nice and lightweight to wear in the slightly warmer weather. It feels very soft and comfortable. I have gotten several compliment on it already. It does need to be hand washed and laid flat to dry. I had no issues with it after washing. It does get a little wrinkled, but it irons out easily without any problems. The size fits great for me. I am about 5'4" and about 130 lbs and I ordered a small, which is what I usually eat with most tops. Overall, this is a very cute, lightweight cardigan. It feels and looks great on. It is a great addition to my wardrobe. I will definitely be ordering more from Elaine and J. Disclaimer: I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. The hat arrived almost completely rolled up and folded and was stuffed into a flimsy plastic bag. Unwearable as is and will cost far more than it's worth to have it properly blocked; I'll try to block it myself but my time is worth something!

The worst thing is I expected, as the title calls it, a wool felt hat. The one we received is clearly marked on the label as acrylic wool, not the same thing at all. Acrylic wool is much, much harder to block.

I'm extremely unhappy with the quality of this hat as well as the outright lie about the material.

UPDATE: The company refunded my money.

Some people might say a black sweater is a black sweater...but they would be wrong.  This little gem of an item is much more than just a black sweater.

Although it is made from a lightweight, thin fabric...it is actually perfect for spring and summer as you don't want anything too heavy.  Just enough to knock off an evening chill.  It is super soft to the touch and the construction is above par and is made in the USA.  The cut is also quite appealing with the pin-tucked neckline and the plunging hemline in the front which provides the illusion of elongating the body making you look taller and thinner.  What girl doesn't want that?!

My favorite part about it...the sleeves.  I am on the shorter side...only 5'2"...so long sleeved items tend to hang well past my fingertips and I spend the better part of my day pushing them up to my elbows.  Somehow, the sleeves on this darling little cardigan are just right!  It is as if it was made for me!

I received this item at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.  With that said, I will be purchasing this cardigan in every color that is offered...great addition to any wardrobe!
summary: Not Just Your Average Black Sweater

reviewText: The cuff links arrived in a very cute cloth pouch with each link wrapped individually.  My husband really liked how these cuff links looked when he wore them with his shirts for work. I absolutely love the color of these  they look almost like a dark gun metal.  They are a solid pair with a decent weight. I could not believe how nice they looked for the price point that they are being sold at. These would easily cost more at a department store. So far, he has worn them almost every day to work for last week or so with no complaints. The cuff links are holding up for daily use.  The color of the links makes them very versatile  easy to dress up for a wedding and easy to dress down for daily wear. I think these are a must have classy pair.  I was given this product for free or at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I'm really torn on these shorts. Really wish I could give it 5 stars.

Pros: Does a really great job when I'm dripping sweat. It is phenomenally better at wicking moisture than some other brands that have "moisture wicking!!" plastered all over the place.

Gorgeous pattern and colour. And it conceals my under garments!

Fabric is comfortable and allows for a lot of movement. As someone who always found spandex as an uncomfortable and restricting material, this is mind blowing.

True to size. I'm typically a size 10 and I got the large. Couldn't have nailed it better.

Yay! Eco friendly!

I love that you can basically do whatever you want in these!!

Cons: but you can't go out in them unless you are petite and/or narrow in the hips. My thighs are 25" around. They are huge and muscular. My hips are so wide that I still have a thigh gap. That combined with the narrowest gusset I've ever seen = the absolute worst lady lines.
I don't know if it is a grading issue, if it makes more sense for the smaller sizes, if it would work for narrower or smaller women, but from my perspective, it is so narrow, I don't even know why time was spent incorporating it into the design. I have child sized hands and it is about the size of my thumb. Less than an inch across.
( but on another note, the gusset IS diamond shaped, so that is a plus )

It rolls up my thighs and down my hips. A bigger size would be too big, smaller definitely too small. So it probably has more to do with my shape. It is a hassle when doing yoga and any weight training involving squats.

Hope that helps!
Love these shorts. I also like to wear them to work out as well as when I wear oversized Adidas t-shirt dresses they are perfect to coverup underneath. Great length.

I loved my first pair of shorts from here so much that I ordered a second pair! They fit well, dry quickly for SUP and SUP yoga activities, never pill or fade from washing. Wish they had drawstring sides, though!!! High quality, durable material.

These are super comfy and nice quality. Not see thru when you bend over. Vibrant and bright colors. Lots of wiggle room in sizing but run true to what I normally wear. Great for water activities as well...quick drying. Ordered another print, too!
summary: Love my shorts, fit true to size
